text:
The President of Ecuador () is the chief of state and the head of government in the country. Under the current Constitution (adopted in 2008), the President is elected by popular (by many people) vote, for a period of four years. They can serve two terms (periods of four years). Before 2008, people could be the president for only one term.
The President of Ecuador right now is Lenín Moreno since May 24, 2017. He was elected as the president on April 2, 2017.
